titles.title: To correct a provision relating to termination of benefits for convicted persons.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Education and the Workforce. H. Rept. 105-446.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 254.
Placed on the Corrections Calendar, Calendar No. 5.

action.text: Called up from the Corrections Calendar for consideration.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the bill, the Speaker pro tempore put the question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Greenwood demanded the yeas and nays and the Speaker pro tempore announced that further proceedings would be postponed until later in the day.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (3/5 required): 408 - 0 (Roll No. 67).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Security.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Thompson under the authority of the order of Jul 31, 98 without amendment. With written report No. 105-296.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 534.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 1/27/1998--Introduced. Amends Federal law concerning Government organization and employees to make a technical correction in the provision terminating receipt of Federal benefits for work injuries by certain convicted felons.
